lines: Commitment Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, hi everybody! Welcome to The Adventure Zone. I am your internet father, Clint McElroy.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Don’t say that! That’s bad— that’s— [crosstalk]

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s weird!

speaker: Clint
lines: Is that a bad thing?

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s a weird look.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, that’s no good. Definitely a weird look.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright, I’ll back off of that. I am your GM. Your game master—

speaker: Justin
lines: Your Griffin McElroy?

speaker: Clint
lines: The general manager.

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh.

speaker: Clint
lines: Along with my three sons. Go ahead and identify your guy— yourselves, guys.

speaker: Travis
lines: This is a— I wanna say, this is a weird start. Are we assuming people listening to this episode have never heard this before?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah! I’m anticipating a whole new influx of new blood.

speaker: Justin
lines: Fresh start, my name is Justin McElroy, I’m the oldest brother, and I’m portraying the dual roles of Irene Baker and Kardala.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m Travis McElroy, I’m the middlest brother, and I am portraying Nadiya Jones.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Folks ’round here call me Griffin McElroy, I’m playing the role of Remy, and I’m going to try to watch how much I talk because I got a lot of tweets from people, maybe a little mean-spirited, accusing me of backseat DMing [Clint laughs] during the world-building episode we did. So, I’mma watch that because I was very sensitive about that, and it did hurt my feelings [Clint Aww] and maybe it was— maybe it was all me, but words hurt and my feelings are fragile.

speaker: Travis
lines: Like, here’s the thing, the real— real question we have to address then is— is it— let’s take it back to backseat driving. Is it backseat driving if the driver has no idea where they’re going, and you in the backseat are giving helpful directions?

speaker: Griffin
lines: If the driver of the car is some sort of baby who’s never driven a car before or perhaps [Travis Right] a big wild dog who jumped in through the window, yeah I would backseat drive on that one ’cause otherwise— [crosstalk]

speaker: Clint
lines: I’ll tell you what if I get us lost, you guys can step in, how’s that sound?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, [Justin Okay] that sounds good. We should mention that you should go listen to the world-building episode. You wanna know everything about- about the thing we’re doing because I think Dad just kinda wants to hop into it, right?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, and there will be some recapping involved in that process.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. [crosstalk]

speaker: Travis
lines: We did a whole hour and a half long episode.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, we did a lot. [Justin Yeah] We should also mention that we’re using Roll20, and we’re gonna not refer to the board that you put together, ’cause the visual element won’t necessarily carry over, but there’s a lot of very good, very stretched out jpegs on this baby.

speaker: Justin
lines: A lot of, Dad put together this imagery. There’s a lot of fun with aspect ratios happening.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah that’s real fun [crosstalk]

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] There’s also three laser barriers—

speaker: Travis
lines: I also like that in Dad’s clip art search, he apparently found two like, people kind of icons, and the rest are a cat, what looks like a blood splatter but purple, a glowing blue eye, a brain—

speaker: Griffin
lines: A floating brain. I can’t wait to talk to brain.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, I went ahead and screencapped this so if you go ahead and tweet me and remind me, I’ll get it out there later.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, Dad, weave a tale. I want it. [Justin Weave.] I want it. I’m ready.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright, you three are brand new recruits to an organization called The Do-Good Fellowship. Uh, and it basically is a humanitarian organization that goes around the world helping people in trouble. It’s a very simple edict of what they do. Um, and you three are part of the newest expansion of this organization, um, up ’till now they’ve been sort of like a think tank, creating ideas, identifying trouble spots, but they now wanna get boots on the ground, so they have instituted their new program where they are bringing in their next… circle, I guess, and these are operatives, and you are three of the 12 new operatives that are being brought in. So, your three characters were brought in on these really cool little VTOL (Vertical Takeoff and Landing) ships called skimmers, called so because they kinda skim along the surface of the water, or on the land, or whatever. And, reported to a place you have affectionately named—

speaker: Travis
lines: So, wait, just to clarify. They do vertical take off and landing and get two inches off the ground?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then they fly reeeal low. I feel like— I feel like— It’s not what they’re designed to do, it’s just all the pilots at the fellowship are real just cocky pieces of shit.

speaker: Clint
lines: I want to visualize this, that there’s this spray up behind them as they skim along—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, I got that spray, I got that spray.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh yeah, spray, spray locked in.

speaker: Clint
lines: It’s very Baywatch-y.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are we on the Berg right now, the headquarters for the fellowship?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, we have flown into the Berg which is the giant floating platform headquarters for the Do-Good Fellowship, that is located toward the middle of the Gulf of Mexico. So it’s outside of United States territorial waters, and outside any other.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I do a murder, because nobody can do anything about it, what’s up?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, I open a floating casino.

speaker: Clint
lines: You guys— you have— it is a Giant Floating Casino of Hope. [Justin laughs] So, right off the bat when you land, you land separately, there’s three different vehicles. These skimmers, by the way, are like drones. They’re operated from the actual Berg themselves.

speaker: Travis
lines: What’s the beverage service like?

speaker: Clint
lines: There are some light beverages, but if you want wine or beer, you have to pay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Ugh, that’s how they get ya.

speaker: Clint
lines: Everything else is complementary, and then there’s peanuts. And these are specially grown peanuts—

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m allergic to peanuts, I— [crosstalk]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, ’cause I was gonna say, I’m allergic to peanuts, you’re saying I’ve eaten peanuts for the first time… I’m adding by the way, the Aspect “allergic to peanuts” to my sheet.

speaker: Clint
lines: So, the very first thing you’re greeted by your three department heads, your separate department heads, Remy you are in Information Technology, Irene is in Humanities, and Nadiya, you are in Research and Development. So, you are greeted by your three department heads. Nadiya’s department head is named Joe, Remy’s department head is Potts, Irene’s department head is Grace. You will be meeting all three of these like, right now. So after a quick stop to freshen up in your quarters, you go to this, what they’re calling, a mixer, and that’s where our first scene takes place.

speaker: Travis
lines: Question one, is it mandatory?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yes.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, then Nadiya is there.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, right off the bat, you’re mixing with strangers. So, I know that’s not exactly Nadiya’s wheelhouse— [crosstalk]

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s not that she can’t do it, I wanna be clear, it’s not that she can’t do it—

speaker: Clint
lines: Right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: She doesn’t prefer it.

speaker: Travis
lines: She has more important things to do with her time.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Remy’s pressin’ the flesh.

speaker: Travis
lines: Gross. Gross, gross, gross.

speaker: Clint
lines: Is that an Aspect? Is that one of her Aspects?

speaker: Travis
lines: What? Yes.

speaker: Clint
lines: She has better things to do with her time than to go meet people?

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s not really an aspect, just a fact. It fits in with my overarching aspect of Values Logic Over Humanity. Hyper-focused scientist, I would say that falls under.

speaker: Clint
lines: There you go, okay. Well, when you walk in this gigantic room, it’s called the Fellowship Hall, and it’s kind of a general purpose meeting debriefing kind of a very flexible arrangement, and you notice when you walk in through the door there are three screens covering almost the entirety of the three walls. Directly in front of you is a great big screen that has the 24 questions logo, the two four question mark logo, which is very important to the Do-Good Fellowship. And that screen has like this big representation of the logo on it, kind of a scroll at the bottom that’s keeping you up to date on local weather and [Travis Heat scores] you know, what’s going on. Yeah, and music that’s playing. We’ll get to that in just a minute. But in front of that screen, great big free open self-serve bar. [Justin Nice] So right off the bat, the bartender is an anomaly in my graphic.

speaker: Travis
lines: Tell me more about the bartender, because he looks very stretched out—

speaker: Clint
lines: He’s not, that’s not, I shouldn’t have— [crosstalk]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Is that his power, that he can stretch super good?

speaker: Clint
lines: It’s, yeah, I tried to crop him out, but I failed.

speaker: Travis
lines: No no no dad, I’m sorry, I know you’re new to this, but when you GM a game, and you have the chance to create a bartender, you create the hell out of that bartender.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You need to make a bartender. [crosstalk]

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, let’s just say that one of the department heads is working bar. [Griffin That’s fine.] Let’s say, Parson, let’s say Parson is tending this bar just as a lark. This is a small operation, there are 24 people on this base covering all these different jobs [crosstalk]

speaker: Travis
lines: Parson is the department head of Risk Understanding. [Clint Right.] I know this because Dad has helpfully created a cheat sheet of all the characters and their positions.

speaker: Clint
lines: On the left side wall, the giant projection screen has this really cool, like color-coded map of the Berg. Where all the different sections are, and every so often it will zoom in and show the different people that work there and show some of the things they do. Kind of an industrial film about The Do-Good Fellowship. And over on the right side projection screen, is just cutting to the different shots of the actual mixer. The different people at the mixer, and what they’re doing.

speaker: Maybe there’s some dancing, there’s a dance floor in the middle, people are dancing, because the music is playing constantly. In front of that screen is this really cool high-tech jukebox, where you just go, it’s voice activated, and you can make a request of practically any song on the planet. So, you look up on that screen, the middle screen, there is the part of the scroll that is the songs that are playing, and who they’re by, and who requested it. So, there’s music playing, you’ve got the bar in front of the top screen, you’ve got the jukebox on the right side. There are four tables about chest-high, abdomen-high, no seats, there’s no chairs. This is a mixer, they don’t want people sitting and just staying there. Then you’ve got four tables in the different corners of the room with all kinds of different food, all finger food, tapas kind of thing, from all over the world, different things that are— [Griffin
lines: They got sliders?] Any what?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sliders.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, they make sliders of every— there’s a whole table of nothing but sliders.

speaker: Justin
lines: Nice.

speaker: Travis
lines: Butt sliders? Gross!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Remy’s going on what he’s called a slider quest, which is he’s going from table to table just, trying trying all the sliders, ‘cause maybe there’s different sliders at the other table. Oh no, this is the same slider, but I’ll keep trying.

speaker: Clint
lines: All four of these tables have all these different kinds of foods and all these different really interesting things. And like I said, the jukebox, the songs don’t stop, people keep going up to the jukebox and making song requests, you’ve got the four food stations, you’ve got the full open bar where you could serve yourself, but Parson has decided he’ll just have some fun and he’ll get up there. Alphabet City by Prince, requested by Abbey, is playing right now. At least, that’s what the scroll says and so—

speaker: Griffin
lines: I look at Abbey and give her a big thumbs up. Good call.

speaker: Clint
lines: It’s playing. So you got your four tables, six people at a table, and the table that you are at right now is the table that has you three and your three directors sitting there. So, this seems to be kind of the meet-and-greet portion of the mixer so take the opportunity to kinda get to know each other, your department heads have introduced you just barely, but you know I think everybody at the table would like to know a little bit about ya, so…

speaker: Travis
lines: Nadiya gets up to go request a song.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, what does Nadiya request?

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh, I’m going to type it in the chat.

lines: Oh boy. [crosstalk]

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughing] Okay—

lines: If it’s gonna be like LMFAO that would be quite a surprise for— oh, Justin actually wrote “Aspect allergic to peanuts,” thank you.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Laughing]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, that’s a very good song for Nadiya.

speaker: Clint
lines: “She Blinded Me with Science” is playing, by Thomas Dolby, so it says “She Blinded Me With Science by Thomas Dolby, requested by Nadiya.” So that starts thrumming up after Alphabet City.

speaker: Irene
lines: Grace, um, I uh wanted you to know that I- I checked on Godfreys’ uh, uh insurance you were asking me, he will be eligible next, um, month, first of the month, if he wants to switch because it’s on an every six month basis, so he’ll be able to switch then.

speaker: Grace
lines: That’s nice Irene, but this— this is a party, honey! This is a party, you don’t have to worry about working!

speaker: Irene
lines: I know, yeah I know, I just wanted to let you know, so I’ll check in with him on it, [Grace Yup.] sorry, I’m really nervous.

speaker: Grace
lines: Ah, don’t worry, do you want to share a little bit honey? Ya know, tell each other about each other, do you wanna tell everybody about yourself? Do you guys wanna ask Irene a question?

speaker: Nadiya
lines: No.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I feel like I probably know Irene, I have an Aspect that is sort of Irene-focused, unless you don’t want that, unless you want this to be the first time we met, but I’m just thinking she’s in Human Resources, I’ve probably dealt with her at some point. Probably not—

speaker: Justin
lines: [cross talk] She’s met, I feel she’s probably met everybody but on a pretty cursory basis—

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, you’ve only be here for like a day or two, so, you know about each other, you know about each other, Remy, because you’re information technology, and…

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Okay, I’ve read their emails.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Laughing]

speaker: Clint
lines: [Laughing] ...and you’ve been gathering information through the process, you guys have been through this really long detailed interview process, and screening process, to get vetted, so do you guys wanna share anything about each other?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, so I look at Irene and say

speaker: Remy
lines: I’m actually relieved, because for a second there I thought you were actually asking us to say grace before we ate dinner, which seems like an irresponsible thing for somebody in HR to do. Do you want a slider?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And I motion to the pyramid, the slider pyramid, that I built on the table.

speaker: Irene
lines: Uh, yeah, uh, what are— what—what kind are they?

speaker: Remy
lines: Meat and… bun. But just take it from the top and not from the bottom ’cause I don’t want it to fall over. Worked pretty hard on this.

speaker: Irene
lines: Is the top one, is that okay?

speaker: Remy
lines: Yeah, I didn’t touch it super a lot.

speaker: Irene
lines: Oh— Okay, I’ll have the top one. Th-Thanks.

speaker: Justin
lines: And she, and she does. Adding Aspect “slider full.”

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughing]

speaker: Travis
lines: Nadiya, during this, is scribbling out various formulae on napkins, some cocktail napkins.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I look at Nadiya and I say—

speaker: Remy
lines: You know it’s a party, right? I don’t think we have to be working right now.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Oh, no, this is— this is fun. I’m— I’m— It’s a thought experiment where I try to challenge myself to see if I can come up with a formula that I can’t solve. So far, not yet.

speaker: Justin
lines: I just want to check on something— this is Justin now. [Travis Uh-huh] I just want to know sort of what the next few months of my life are going to be like. Are your guys character voices just not— just they’re— they’re just you guys? [crosstalk] Is that sort of what we’re doing?

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Mine’s more of— mine’s kind of me, but like very positive.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well here’s the thing, yeah, I—

speaker: Justin
lines: Is this your way around the Justin McElroy character voice [crosstalk] sort of policing?

speaker: Travis
lines: I was trying to come up with a character voice for Nadiya and I— I feel like it’ll find itself, you know what I mean?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, let’s not— let’s not sweat it.

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] I don’t want to force it.

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright, okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: And I’m doing 22 character voices [crosstalk] at least so…

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Yeah, tell me about it.

speaker: Justin
lines: That’s great.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I ask Nadiya to see if she can use math to help me with my burger pyramid. Maybe there’s some way that I can make it sort of more structurally sound, using some sort of formula.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: You want— you want me to stop what I’m doing… to help you figure out how to stack… your small burgers?

speaker: Remy
lines: Burger pyramid. Yeah, they’re sliders. They call them sliders. There’s a name for it.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Okay. Maybe you could try eating one small burger at a time and leaving some… for everyone else?

speaker: Remy
lines: Oh, no, I’m gonna wimpy down on pretty much all of these, but—

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughing]

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Great. Great, great, great. I’m… gonna go back to my napkin now. Excuse me.

speaker: Irene
lines: Nadiya, I— I— I hate to interrupt, I— I do want to mention just as long as we’re both here, um—

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Yes, HR person?

speaker: Irene
lines: I— I did still need the— your expense reports for your meals on the way in here.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: [cross talk] Right, right, right.

speaker: Irene
lines: I— I don’t know if you saw— I asked everybody to send those in as soon as you can. It’s— It’s no big deal— [crosstalk]

speaker: Nadiya
lines: I’m sorry, I’m just— yeah. You know what, that one’s on me, you know, because I was working on life-saving technology and science, but you know what, now that you mention it, it is important that I get you that Wendy’s receipt. Sooo, um… [crosstalk]

speaker: Remy
lines: Hell yeah, Wendy’s! [crosstalk]

speaker: Nadiya
lines: I— cool.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Laughing] At this point Joe speaks up

speaker: Joe
lines: Ah, listen, ah- listen there, Nadiya. This is a party, and everybody— starting tomorrow, you guys are gonna be pretty busy with your work and with the big changes in your life. So why don’t you just blow off a little steam and get to know each other, okay?

speaker: Remy
lines: Love that— love that voice, dude, where ya from?

speaker: Joe
lines: Fargo.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Laughing]

speaker: Remy
lines: Excellent, uh, Fargo, North Dakota.

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] Dad got about three seconds into that before Travis typed in the chat “Aspect Nadiya does not care for Joe.”

speaker: Joe
lines: Well ya know nobody does like their boss. Nobody cares for their boss.

speaker: Justin
lines: Like three syllables.

speaker: Clint
lines: Just then, “She Blinded Me With Science” is starting to end, it was a big choice too, put quite a few people on the dance floor.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Excuse me.

speaker: Travis
lines: And Nadiya goes in to request it again.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Laughing] Well before it plays, “Everybody Wants to Rule the World” by Tears for Fears, requested by Martine, that shows up. After a few minutes of this incredibly warm and bonding conversation, Hugh gets up. Where did I put Hugh…?

speaker: Travis
lines: Is he the floating brain or the cat?

speaker: Clint
lines: No.

speaker: Justin
lines: Diversity Inclusion.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, Diversity Inclusion. [Travis Okay] So, Hugh gets up and Hugh says

speaker: Hugh
lines: Uh, hi everybody, my name is Hugh. Welcome, [Travis Hi, Hugh.] to our little get-together. It’s, uh, I’m happy to have you all here now. I’m kinda introducing the next phase of our— our little program. Um, I’d like everybody, if you aren’t already at your tables, to please move to your— to your tables. Uh, and, uh, the other department heads are, uh, are bringing to your tables, to your spot, these, uh, well I guess we’ll call them swag bags. Uh, these swag bags are, uh, [Griffin wheezes in laughter] are our gift to you. But they’re more than just gifts. They’re things that you’ll— you’re really going to, uh, to want to use.

speaker: Travis
lines: There an iPod Touch in here?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I didn’t know how bad I wanted to hear that voice say the word swag until you did it and now—

speaker: Clint
lines: [in Hugh’s voice] Swag bag.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And now it’s changed—

speaker: Travis
lines: [imitating Hugh] Swag!

speaker: Hugh
lines: And we welcome you to the Do-Good Fellowship here at the Berg. And, uh, we are based— I think you already know this from your own research, I know we’ve talked to ya— we are based on the old concept of The Junto that Ben Franklin started centuries ago. And every meeting of the Junto started with 24 questions, and, uh, those 24 questions are very important to how we operate here at the— at the Do-Good Fellowship. So I think you all have copies of them. I’d like to share those questions with you. I’d like ya to each take a couple and read them out loud. And, so, um, so this is kinda of like our Pledge of Allegiance but we’ll do it, uh, separately. I’m gonna start with this table over here.

speaker: Clint
lines: And you hear these voices and they start to read the 24 questions.

speaker: Voice
lines: Have you met with any thing in the author you last read, remarkable, or suitable to be communicated to the Junto, particularly in history, morality, poetry, physics, travels, mechanic arts, or other parts of knowledge? What news story have you lately heard agreeable for telling and conversation? Three! Hath any citizen in your knowledge failed in his business lately? And what have you heard of the cause?

speaker: Justin
lines: If you were to look over at Irene during this, you would note and you would look closely you would notice her mouthing the words. She’s like, deeply deeply into this.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well then—

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think— I think I—

speaker: Travis
lines: I also! I also want you to know that uh, when Number 3 is read “Has any citizen in your knowledge failed in his business lately?” Um, Nadiya is just like, staring at Remy.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I did my best! I’m taking— I don’t notice cause I’m taking notes. Cause I really wanna ace this… test?

speaker: Clint
lines: Let’s start with your table. Irene, why don’t you start.

speaker: Irene
lines: What unhappy effects of impertinence have you lately observed or heard? Of imprudence? Of passion? Of any other vice or folly? Have you or any of your acquaintances been lately sick or wounded? If so, what remedies were used, and what were their effects?

speaker: Voice
lines: Remy, would you take over please?

speaker: Irene
lines: Oh can I— I’m sorry, can I do one more? Ten’s my—

speaker: Voice
lines: Okay, do one more.

speaker: Irene
lines: Ten’s my favorite. Who do you know that are shortly going on voyages or journeys if one should have occasion to send by them?

speaker: Voice
lines: M’kay, Remy?

speaker: Remy
lines: Yeah sure, uh, “Do you think of anything at present in which the Junto may be serviceable to mankind, to their country, to their friends, or to themselves? Uh, hath any—” Hath? When was this? Okay, uh, “Hath any deserving stranger arrived in town since last meeting, that you heard of? And what have you heard or observed of his character or merits? And whether think you, it lies in the power of the Junto to oblige him, or encourage him as he deserves? Do you—”

speaker: Justin
lines: This is out of character. Listener, that was Number 12, we’re halfway there, baby. We told you it was gonna be rough going, we’re going to read this very— [Clint laughs] I thought something was gonna explode, honestly, I thought we were gonna get three questions in and then he was gonna be like [imitating Clint] And then Skeletor [crosstalk] was like, “Fuck all of this!”

lines: Alright, can we post this too?

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, the whole—

lines: Yeah, sure!

lines: Post the whole list and then we’ll move on.

lines: And then they did the rest of them and everyone was into it.

lines: And then as the propellers spun, it cut to the end of the list, Number 24!

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Do you see anything amiss in the present customs or proceedings of the Junto, which might be amended?

speaker: Clint
lines: Ooh! Good, I’m glad you skipped to that one.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: And this like the Kiwanis that they say the Kiwanis’ pledge, at the beginning of— of every— of every—

lines: After reading this, how can they do this—

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, the Kiwanis—

lines: Now that the first hour and fifteen minutes has passed, we shall begin the meeting of the Junto.

lines: So, we’re gonna give a little bit more time to check out your uh, your swag bags.

speaker: Clint
lines: So uh these swag bags are— It’s not— It’s not really fair to call them swag bags because they do have, uh, a purpose. They’re like, cylindrical, almost. Made of, uh, made of a kind of unusual fabric— like a duffel bag but you could wear it as a backpack or you can wear it as a duffel bag. And there’s a flap, and the flap has a triangular indentation on the front of it.

lines: Um, I think there’s been some kind of mistake, cause my swag bag is just filled with koozies.

lines: No, you haven’t opened them yet.

speaker: Travis

speaker: Clint
lines: Grey, Flanagan and Addison break into a run.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah we’re running too! Can I roll Athletics? I’m super fast.

speaker: Justin
lines: But you can’t go first. [ Griffin I know.] I have to go first.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well you’re closer to the door.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay we’re running.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright we—

speaker: Justin
lines: We’re running.

speaker: Griffin
lines: We- We sprint  through it, Irene, me, Nadiya.

speaker: Clint
lines: You have solved the color puzzle.

speaker: Justin and Griffin
lines: Yaaaay!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I do a flip through the door as I go cause that’s how I- That’s who I am.

speaker: Travis
lines: And uh Nadiya flips off uh the other team.

speaker: Clint
lines: As you come out, Joe and Potts and Grace are there and Joe says

speaker: Joe
lines: I knew you guys would be the first three to do it. I knew [Nadiya Shut up, Joe.] you’d win!

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Joe shut up.

speaker: Remy
lines: Thank you, Joe. That means a lot.

speaker: Justin
lines: Irene turns to the people coming through the door now

speaker: Irene
lines: Hey guys that was so much fun, thank you! We’ll get— You- You all will get ’em next time we- we just barely made it. Wasn’t that fun though? It seemed really fun!

speaker: Clint
lines: And Sylvane just looks at you like he could stab you in the head.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Your vest won’t protect against that so be careful.

speaker: Clint
lines: Potts says

speaker: Potts
lines: Alright listen you guys, that was awesome. We’re very proud of you but as you know, you have a very big day tomorrow. Tomorrow is the day we do the augmentation so… go to your rooms.

speaker: Justin
lines: Woah! Woah. I don’t see Potts on my guest list, what does Potts do?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He’s IT head. He’s my— [crosstalk]

speaker: Clint
lines: Remy’s boss.

speaker: Remy
lines: Hey Potts can you uh back up and start over and particularly focus on sorta the augmentation part of it this time around. Am I gonna get a… third maybe a fourth leg- What’s— what are we talking about? Blasters in the chest-what are you— what do you— Hey Potts, what are you talking about man?

speaker: Potts
lines: You know what? You guys have had a lot thrown at you today. Bright and early tomorrow morning the- the prep crew—

speaker: Remy
lines: You can’t— Potts! You just! You can’t just mention body augmentation and then walk it back, Potts!

speaker: Potts
lines: Well we’ll tell you about it in the morning. We’ll have a big debriefing tomorrow morning- a big breakfast debriefing so be thinking about what you wanna eat! And we’ll talk about it and we’ll- we’ll give you the waivers. This is totally your choice. We’ll talk about it in the morning, okay?

speaker: Nadiya
lines: So it’s not a cult? Wait, it’s not a cult?

speaker: Remy
lines: I don’t think it’s a cult. I think we’re probably good on that front. Is it… Potts! On the scale of ear piercing to second head attachment, where are we landing vis-à-vis augmentation, I’d hate to get hung up on this.

speaker: Potts
lines: Let’s say 75 percent more towards the head thing.

speaker: Remy
lines: Oh my god…

speaker: Potts
lines: But I’m telling you, it is going to transform your life. It is absolutely amazing what’s gonna happen to you.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Okay so just one last time not a cult.

speaker: Potts
lines: Not a cult.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Okay.

speaker: Potts
lines: It- It might be cult-ish.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Alright, cult-adjacent.

speaker: Remy
lines: Uh one last question, can we go back into the room now that we’ve just solved the test?

speaker: Potts
lines: Yeah! Are you still hungry?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I go get my pyramid of burgers.

speaker: Remy
lines: I’mma finish these in my room, I’ll see you guys tomorrow!

speaker: Irene
lines: Alright get some sleep.

speaker: Remy
lines: I’m not gonna be sleeping great after eating 20 sliders but we’ll see about that.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay um next morning rolls around. You go to a uh- one of the private dining rooms um in the section um— matter of fact, uh each one of the wings has their own private dining rooms and for right now you’re in Humanities. Remember Humanity in the Do-Good Fellowship also includes medical so your three department heads are actually all three there. You sit down at a table, they give you chairs this time, and you’re having a breakfast. And so uh Joe and Potts and uh Grace are talking to you. And uh Joe starts off cause he’s the head of R&D and he says

speaker: Joe
lines: Alright I know you- you folks have a lot of questions about the process. Um and I- I wanna tell you about it. It’s called the Stimplant Process. Stimplants are these very tiny molecular bonds that we introduce into your system. And the Stimplants automatically go to places in your body to emphasize whether it’s mental, whether it’s physical, whatever it is that um act as little tiny bio-organic um enhancers. Uh the process- we have a really good idea how it works uh and ironically uh it’s- it’s based on research that Nadiya here has done. Nadiya uh tell ‘em a little about your- the research that you do— that you do with the uh the artificial uh skin.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Yeah, um, so basically what I’ve created is a kind of smart biopolymer. Um it acts uh- where you would normally need skin from a donor. Um it acts as both the skin and a bandage. It um— it mimics human skin, it grows, it changes, it heals… and over time bonds with- with the person who receives it um and becomes part of their body. It’s basically amazing and a miracle and I did it and you’re all welcome.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I rai— Remy raises his hand and waits.

speaker: Joe
lines: Yes! Yes— [ Nadiya Yeah… yeah Remy?] Yeah Remy?

speaker: Remy
lines: I- I think I’m good on skin. I appreciate the offer but like I have plenty of skin already and I don’t need extra skin. Where would it go even I guess is my first question— on top of the skin that’s already there? Or would it just kinda dangle off? Cause that’s I—

speaker: Clint
lines: Now this—and this is where Grace steps in and she says um—

speaker: Grace
lines: The technology that we use, almost introduces you into a cocoon that sorta covers your entire body.

speaker: Remy
lines: [disgusted] Skin cocoon?

speaker: Grace
lines: And it— well now wait— you emerge from the cocoon after the Stimplants are injected into you. So that’s— you’re not gonna have extra skin hanging off of ya like a big goiter or something uh it’s just the way that we get the Stimplants into your system. There’s no pain involved whatsoever.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Can we please stop talking about my miracle creation like it’s a gross skin thing? Like it’s—

speaker: Remy
lines: No It’s— it’s good skin.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: It’s like plastic or silly putty or- or some kind of—it’s- it’s- it’s not skin…

speaker: Remy
lines: Yeah I guess— I guess I’m confused are we— are we talking about steroids here? Cause I’m- I don’t think I wanna do that. I don’t wanna get DQ’d from the next qualifier. It’s not steroids right?

speaker: Clint
lines: And Potts says- Potts says

speaker: Potts
lines: Well I gotta tell you- you are gonna be permanently changed. This is not a reversible process and that’s why we have to make sure that all three of you want to go through this process. There’s something else you need to know about the process. Once it’s established, with these Stimplants and once you three have gained these abilities, these abilities only work in these three parts. In other words, the three of you have to be within a hundred yards of each other for these abilities to function.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Is that mandatory?

speaker: Potts
lines: I think I’m gonna be telling you that everything’s mandatory from this point on. In other words, you three have to function within that proximity of each other for your abilities to work.

speaker: Travis
lines: Um I am actually going to do a— what’s it called when you make yourself do something? A—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Compel?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah! I’m gonna do a Compel on myself, one of my aspects is Remy needs to be pushed. Um and I’m going to do that now and turn to Remy and say

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Don’t be a coward. There’s no jumps in technology without risk.

speaker: Travis
lines: And Nadiya rolls up her sleeves and shows a patch of this smart polymer that she tested on herself.

speaker: Nadiya
lines: When I couldn’t get approval to test this on humans, I did it myself, and now I’m in the running for the Nobel Prize. Sooo—

speaker: Remy
lines: Yeah I kn—

speaker: Nadiya
lines: Don’t be scared- [ Remy I’m not—] and try it.

speaker: Remy
lines: I’m not scared. I mean, you— earlier I think someone said the term skin cocoon and I- that’s gonna be sort of rattling around my cage for a while but um… I— just to be— I need to clarify something real quick— Hey Potts?

speaker: Potts
lines: Mmhm?

speaker: Remy
lines: Are you about to give us superpowers?

speaker: Potts
lines: Remy, Irene, Nadiya. We are about to make you gods.

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Commitment Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]
